email.title: DoCSoc Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone!
We're back again for another week of merch, events and free pizza!
email.heading: Final Merch Sale and Collections
email.text:
Our merch is still available for purchase on [the union shop](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/shop/student-groups/119)!
If you're a fresher and haven't collected your freshers merch yet or you ordered merch from our summer drop last year and haven't collected it, you can also grab it now.
**Collection ends this week, you'll have no other chances to get your merch after Friday. This includes all merch purchased between now and Friday.**
## Collection slots
- Monday 4th Nov, 4:15pm-6pm, Huxley 315 - Friday 8th Nov, 3:00pm-5pm, Huxley 315
email.heading: Breakfast

event.text: Come and join us tomorrow for a lovely start of your morning with some free breakfast!

email.heading: IC Hack 25 Long-term Volunteer Info Session

event.text:
IT BEGINS! Want to help organise an event with more than 550 participants, that takes over the whole campus next February? One of Imperial's largest, most complex events? The one event to rule them all?
Monday 4th starts the organisation for ICHack 25, the UK's largest student-ran hackathon. No matter what your skills or talents - we have a team for you:
Like food? Entertainment? Bar nights? Join our Hacker Experience team! Or want to boss all of those people around? Join our Logistics team!
Find out more about all the roles you can help with, and how you can join us, Monday 4th - no event signup required.

email.heading: Rust 101

event.text:
ðŸ¦€ Curious about Rust?
Join us for Rust 101 and dive into the basics of this powerful systems programming language! Learn why Rust is loved for its performance, memory safety, and concurrency.
No prior experience required! Sign up [here](https://buytickets.at/docsoc/1456406/r/mailshot)

email.heading: HRT Sponsor Event

event.text:
At DoCSoc x AlgoSoc event, we'll be hosting one of our sponsors, Hudson River Trading for a tech talk.
Sign up [here](https://events.hrt.careers/iclttf24)

email.heading: Marshall Wace Sponsor Event

event.text:
At Marshall Wace we make extensive use of stream processing technology in order to build systems that process data quickly and at a huge scale (millions of events per second). This talk explains the basics of stream processing and the dataflow model, how it differs from traditional data processing, challenges involved, and where it works well (or doesn't!). No prior knowledge of distributed systems or real time data processing is expected! Knowing what a database is and the basics of any programming language is helpful.
If you'd like to come, signup [here](https://buytickets.at/docsoc/1456355/r/mailshot)
